required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: IVM With Low Cost Priming, Enhanced Oocyte Recovery, and Delayed Transfer
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Series of IVF Cases Utilizing in Vitro Maturation (IVM) With Low Cost Priming, Enhanced Oocyte Recovery, and Delayed Embryo Transfer Using a Subsequent Frozen Embryo Transfer Cycle

brief_summary.textblock: A protocol was developed to improve pregnancy results after IVM compared to results from studies in the literature. Differences from most published protocols include the use of the Steiner-Tan needle to optimize oocyte environment during oocyte retrieval, use of oral medications and very low doses of FSH, and delayed embryo transfer during subsequent warmed cryo-preserved embryo transfer. Eligible patient have a PCO pattern in their ovaries during transvaginal ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock: All participants are candidates for IVF having PCOS or having PCO patterns in their ovaries who wish to undertake IVM for the potential advantages that it holds. All cycles are proceeded by oral contraceptive use for cycle scheduling purposes. Priming is done with oral letrozole with the addition of 25-75 IU daily starting after 2 days of letrozole. HCG is given when several follicle have diameters 8 mm or greater and no follicles have diameters greater than 13 mm. Oocyte retrieval is done approximately 38 hours later. A Steiner-Tan needle is used for oocyte retrieval in a manner that minimizes the amount of time that an oocyte is out of the ovary and not in a controlled laboratory environment. Oocytes are assessed for maturity for up to 48 hours post retrieval. If mature, oocytes are injected with sperm using ICSI. Embryos are grown to blastocysts and all blastocyst are vitrified. Warmed cryo-preserved blastocyst are transferred using routine IVF protocols during a subsequent cycle.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of treated patients having a clinical pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: ultrasound evidence of pregnancy in uterus or tissue evidence of pregnancy

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of treated patients having an ongoing pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: pregnancy with cardiac activity (by history or observations) after 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of retrieved oocytes which matured per patient
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of retrieved oocytes which are mature (polar body present) within 48 hours of retrieval

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of retrieved oocytes which fertilized per patient
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of mature oocytes which display pronuclei

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of fertilized oocytes which divided
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of fertilized oocytes which become 2 or more cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of fertilized oocytes which became blastocysts per patient
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of fertilized oocytes which form a fluid filled cavity

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who have a biochemical pregnancy after therir first transfer
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients with an hCG level greater than 5 measured post first transfer

other_outcome.measure: Number of clinical pregnancies from subsequent transfers
other_outcome.time_frame: up to one year after transfer of last patient enrolled
other_outcome.description: Number of clinical pregnancies from all blastocyst transfers related to the retrieval

other_outcome.measure: Number of ongoing pregnancies from subsequent transfers
other_outcome.time_frame: up to one year after transfer of last patient enrolled
other_outcome.description: Number of ongoing pregnancies from blastocyst transfers related to the retrieval

arm_group.description: Patients requiring IVF treatment with PCOS or a PCO pattern in their ovaries who wish to undertake IVM (as a variant of their IVF procedure)

intervention.description: Immature oocytes (rather than mature oocytes) are harvested as in IVF. These oocytes are allowed to mature in the laboratory before fertilization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- PCO pattern with > 25 antral follicles
- AMH > 3.5
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 35
- body morphology making transvaginal retrieval difficult or impossible
- complicating medical condition making pregnancy or IVF relatively contra-indicated

eligibility.gender_description: genetic female with ovaries and uterus

reference.citation: Rose BI. The potential of letrozole use for priming in vitro maturation cycles. Facts Views Vis Obgyn. 2014;6(3):150-5.

Rose BI: The case for more active management of endometrial development in IVM: Decreasing the miscarriage rate and increasing the clinical pregnancy rate. Journal of Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility, 14: 1-6, 2016

Rose BI, Laky D. A comparison of the Cook single lumen immature ovum IVM needle to the Steiner-Tan pseudo double lumen flushing needle for oocyte retrieval for IVM. J Assist Reprod Genet. 2013 Jun;30(6):855-60. doi: 10.1007/s10815-013-0006-1. Epub 2013 May 5.
